summary: This is an email from Amazon's Law Enforcement Response Team to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, transmitting Amazon's response to a subpoena (Case No. 20 Mag. 6216). The email notes redactions of titles of expressive materials and Amazon's objections regarding the volume and burden of the request.

persons.name: Teresa Rodelo
persons.role: Manager, Law Enforcement Response Team at Amazon.com, Inc.
persons.context: She is the sender of the email transmitting Amazon's response to a law enforcement subpoena, citing privacy and legal reasons for redactions.

persons.name: Alison Moe
persons.context: She is the primary recipient of the email from Amazon regarding the subpoena response.

persons.name: Ben Langner
persons.context: He is copied on the email regarding Amazon's response to the subpoena.

persons.name: Maurene Comey
persons.context: She is copied on the email regarding Amazon's response to the subpoena.

connections.description: Rodelo, representing Amazon, is communicating with AUSA Moe regarding compliance with a law enforcement subpoena.
Both are Assistant U.S. Attorneys (USANYS) copied on the same legal correspondence.
Both are Assistant U.S. Attorneys (USANYS) copied on the same legal correspondence.

events.title: Amazon Submits Response to Subpoena
events.description: Amazon's Law Enforcement Response Team sends its response to a subpoena (Case No. 20 Mag. 6216) to the U.S. Attorney's Office, noting redactions and objections.

locations.context: Address for Amazon.com, Inc. provided in the email signature.

keyFacts: Amazon was served with a subpoena (Case No. 20 Mag. 6216) as part of a law enforcement investigation, likely related to the Epstein case given the document set.
Amazon redacted the titles of 'expressive materials' in its response, citing privacy and legal reasons.
Amazon formally objected to the subpoena, stating the request was 'unusually voluminous' and would cause 'an undue burden'.
The communication involves the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS), indicating federal investigation activity in 2020.
